name: Abusive, Neglectful Families
description: Families in which one or more persons have experienced a continued pattern of physical, sexual or emotional abuse, including extreme neglect of an individual's needs.

name: Sexually Assaulted Adults
description: Persons 18 or older who have been raped or otherwise sexually assaulted.

name: Adult Sexual Assault Survivors
description: Adults who, as a child, survived an actual or attempted act of rape, forced oral copulation, sodomy or other sexual assault or abuse which was perpetrated by a parent, extended family member or other individual whom the child trusted.

name: African-Americans
description: Americans of African descent who share a common cultural heritage.

name: AIDS
description: AIDS (symptomatic HIV infections) is a disease that impairs the functioning of one's immune system, leaving affected individuals vulnerable to illnesses that would not occur otherwise.

name: Asthma
description: A condition of the bronchial system that causes labored breathing and wheezing due to the spasm of the bronchial tubes or the mucous membranes.

name: Battered Men
description: Adult men who have been subject to repeated physical, verbal, or sexual abuse at the hands of their partners.

name: Batterers
description: Individuals who repeatedly physically or sexually abuse adult members of their family or other persons living in their home.

name: Children
description: Persons ages 4-12.

name: Children of Subs. Abuse Parent
description: Children or adolescents affected by one or both parents abusing drugs.

name: Developmental Delay
description: When an infant or child shows evidence of being behind in the development of a physical, mental or emotional milestone than what is considered normal.

name: Developmental Disability
description: Neurological impairments, including mental retardation, cerebral palsy, epilepsy, and autism, which appear before the age of 18 and are expected to continue throughout an individual's lifetime.

name: Physical Disability
description: Any condition which impairs an individual's ability to walk, sit, stand or use their hands.

name: Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgend
description: Programs that provide specialized services to Gays, Lesbians, bisexuals and or/transgendered individuals.

name: Hearing Impairments
description: A defect in part of the ear that keeps a person from hearing adequately.

name: Homeless
description: Programs that provide services to persons without a permanent residence or place to stay.

name: Jewish Community
description: Programs that provide special services to persons of the Jewish faith.

name: Men
description: Individuals who have needs and interests in common as a result of similar experiences, concerns or expectations as males.

name: Men, Young African-American
description: Young men of African descent whose cultural heritage derives from their common experience in the Americas.

name: Mental Illness, Emot. Disturb
description: Behavior or patterns of behavior which impair an individual's ability to function on a personal, social and/or occupational level.

name: Parents of Children 4-12 Years
description: Family units that consist of parents and one or more offspring from ages four through twelve.

name: Parents of Adolescents
description: Family units that consist of parents and one or more offspring age thirteen through seventeen.

name: Pregnant Women
description: Women, over the age of 18, who are awaiting the birth of a child.

name: Dual Diagnosis
description: A person who is diagnosed with having a mental illness as well as having some kind of chemical dependency.

name: Renters
description: Programs serving persons who pay a monthly payment to a landlord for housing.

name: Runaways
description: Children or adolescents who have been abandoned by the adults responsible for their care or who have left  their homes without notice or parental consent and who have no fixed place of residence.

name: Hispanic, Latino Community
description: Programs that provide services to Americans of Spanish or Latin American decent.

name: Adolescents
description: Youth ages 13-17.

name: Terminal Illness
description: An illness which, because of its nature, can be expected to cause the individual to die.

name: Low Income
description: Programs that provide services to persons whose income is one hundred and fifty or two hundred percent of poverty level for their family size.

name: Visual Impairment
description: Eye or optic nerve malfunctions which prevent affected individuals from seeing normally.

name: Women
description: Individuals who have needs and interests in common as a result of similar experiences, concerns or expectations as females.

name: Asians
description: People whose ethnic background is that of one of the people of the Asian continent or the islands of the Pacific Ocean.

name: Native Americans
description: Individuals whose ethnic background and ancestry are that of the tribal, aboriginal peoples who originated in the western hemisphere.

name: Abused Adults
description: Individuals aged 18 and older who have been subjected to a persistent pattern of physical, sexual or emotional maltreatment by their caretakers, spouses, partners or other family members.

name: Juvenile Delinquents
description: Individuals under the age of 18 who have violated a county, city or state law; have run away from home or are beyond the control of a parent or guardian.

name: Day Care Providers
description: Programs that establish and enforce health, safety and quality of care standards for foster homes and programs that offer day care for dependents.

name: Immigrants
description: Persons from other countries who wish to enter the United States or obtain United States citizenship.

name: Refugees
description: Individuals who have left their native county and been given permission by the government to reside in the United States or Canada.

name: Military Personnel & Family
description: Individuals and their families who are affiliated with one of the branches of the armed forces as active duty enlisted men or officers, retired career military or veterans.

name: Veterans & Family
description: Individuals or family members of individuals who are former members of one of the branches of the armed forces and who have received an honorable discharge or the like and now receive benefits and privileges.

name: Speech Impairment
description: Any number of conditions that interfere with the ability to make the audible sounds needed to communicate effectively.

name: Travelers, Transients
description: People whose permanent places of residence are elsewhere and who are visiting a particular community or traveling through the community.

name: Migrants & Family
description: People who move from one temporary residence to another, usually in search or temporary or seasonal employment.

name: Victims, Witnesses
description: Individuals who have suffered physical injury, emotional distress and/or loss of property as the result of an actual or attempted crime by another person or by a destructive act of nature.

name: Parents-Single
description: Family units which consist of either a father or a mother and one or more children.

name: Parents-Step
description: The mother or father of a child born during a previous marriage of the other parent.

name: Parents-Separated, Divorced
description: Families whose members are unable to live together due to the illness, imprisonment, military or job assignment or political detention abroad of one or more of their members or due to divorce.

name: Offenders, Ex-offenders
description: Individuals who have committed or are at risk of committing acts that have been defined as felonies or misdemeanors by federal or state laws or municipal or local ordinances.

name: Learning Disability
description: A disorder where one or more of the processes needed to understand or use written or spoken language are impaired.  The disorder may manifest itself in an impaired ability to listen, think, read, write, spell or perform mathematical calculations.

name: Infants, Toddlers
description: Individuals from birth to age three.

name: Parent Aide, Mentoring
description: Programs that provide companionship, guidance and/or role models for at-risk parents.

name: Senior Citizens
description: Individuals who are age fifty, fifty-five, sixty-two or sixty-five or older depending on the minimum age for qualifying as senior citizens which varies by program.

name: Eating Disorders
description: Conditions which cause a person to become obsessed with eating and their weight.  The individual may compulsively overeat, engage in eating binges which may or may not be followed by purging, refuse to eat or otherwise use food in a self-destructive manner.

name: Organizations, Services for
description: Programs that strengthen, support and enhance the capability of human service organizations, small businesses, and other groups  to deliver products and services.

name: Scoliosis
description: A condition where an individual has abnormal curvature of the spine.

name: Survivors
description: Individuals who have suffered physical injury, emotional distress and/or loss of property as the result of an actual or attempted criminal offense by another person or through a destructive act of nature.

name: Alzheimers, Dementia
description: A form of presenile dementia that usually occurs in people between the ages of forty and sixty.  Causes progressive and irreversible loss of memory, disorientation and deterioration of intellectual functions, accompanied by behavioral disturbances.

name: Sleep Disorders
description: A number of conditions that affect a person's ability to sleep, stay asleep or some cases the ability to stay awake during the day.

name: Teen Fathers and, or Mothers
description: Adolescents who are mothers or fathers.

name: Head Trauma
description: Programs serving persons who have sustained head injuries, resulting in destruction of brain tissue and loss of brain function.

name: Cancer
description: Any group of malignant cells that adversely affects an individual's health and well being.

name: Schools
description: Programs that provide a formal education for children, adolescents and adults through a graded system of instruction that focuses initially on basic skills such as reading, writing and mathematics and later on a broader curriculum.

name: Caregivers
description: Persons who care for individuals, on a regular, on-going basis, who are unable to care for themselves due to some medical or emotional reason.

name: Union Members
description: Individuals who have a membership in a union.

name: Parents of Infants, Toddlers
description: Family units that consist of parents and one or more offspring from birth through age three.

name: Kidney Disease
description: Any number of diseases involving the kidneys and how they function.

name: Diabetes
description: A disorder in which the pancreas produces too little insulin so that the body is unable to adequately metabolize sugar.

name: Muscular Dystrophy
description: A disease characterized by progressive atrophy and wasting of the muscles.

name: Multiple Sclerosis
description: A chronic, slowly progressive disease causing difficulties with muscle control, involuntary movements of the eyes, speech problems and tremors.

name: Dwarfism
description: The condition of being abnormally small in stature.

name: Parkinsons Disease
description: A chronic nervous condition which causes slow spreading tremors, muscular weakness and a peculiar gait.

name: Emergency Shelter-Battered Wom
description: Programs that provide temporary emergency shelter to women who have experienced ongoing physical, verbal, or sexual abuse at the hands of their partners.

name: Lupus Erythematosus
description: Condition which causes lesions on the face, neck and upper extremities and can cause inflammation of the joints, kidneys, nervous system and mucous membranes.

name: Sickle Cell Anemia
description: A hereditary chronic form of anemia in which abnormal sickle or crescent-shaped red blood cells are present causing an abnormal type of hemoglobin.

name: Sudden Infant Death Syndrome
description: The unexpected and unexplainable death of an otherwise healthy infant.

name: AIDS Control
description: Programs that attempt to control the number of cases of AIDS through research, so the medical community can better understand the disease and eventually limit the number of new cases.

name: AIDS Screening
description: Programs that offer HIV tests to determine whether a person has the HIV virus in their blood stream.

name: AIDS Treatment
description: Programs that offer inpatient and outpatient treatments aimed at helping those individuals with the HIV virus or AIDS live longer and fuller lives.

name: Adoption, Adoptee Services
description: Programs that participate in the process of finding permanent homes and parents for children whose natural parents must, for some reason, find alternative living arrangements for them, OR services that provide ongoing support to adoptees.

name: Adult Basic Education
description: Programs that teach adults fundamental learning skills they were never taught due to interrupted schooling. Emphasis is placed on basic reading, language and mathematics.

name: Adult Day Care
description: Programs that provide supervised care for dependent adults during some part of the day. Services may include social and recreational activities, independent skills training, and meals, as appropriate.

name: Advocacy
description: Programs that work for legislative solutions to problems,  or which intercede on behalf of others to ensure that their rights are upheld or that they receive benefits which are due them.

name: Bathing Facilities
description: Programs that offer showers, baths and other facilities to those who do not have access to these type of facilities privately.

name: Battered Women
description: Adult women who have been subject to repeated physical, verbal, or sexual abuse at the hands of their partners.

name: Hotlines-Battered Adults
description: Programs that provide telephone crisis intervention to persons being battered and will help find them programs that will aid them in getting out of that situation.

name: Burial Expense Assistance
description: Programs that provide or pay for burial services to those individuals whose income is insuffient to cover the cost of burial.

name: Camps
description: Programs that develop, maintain and make available to the community facilities for cooperative group living experiences in the out-of-doors; and which offer a wide range of activities under the supervision of trained leadership for children, youth, adults and special groups of all ages.

name: Career Counseling
description: Programs that provide career advice and guidance and evaluate an individual's abilities and interests in order to help them choose a vocation.

name: Case Management
description: Programs that develop plans for the evaluation, treatment, and/or care of individuals who cannot, for some reason, arrange for these services themselves.

name: Substance Abuse-Assessment
description: Programs that evaluate individuals who are in need of substance abuse services and refer them to the inpatient, outpatient or residential treatment services they require.

name: Charities, Foundations, Funding
description: Programs that solicit contributions, endowments or funds from private or public sources to either directly support human services provided by the organization or to provide financial support for other human service programs in the community.

name: Hotlines-Child Abuse
description: Programs that provide telephone crisis intervention for parents that have abused or are afraid they might abuse their children. Also may help children being abused by adults.

name: Child Safety Seats
description: Programs that provide, loan or pay for child safety seats used to restrain infants and children while seated in cars.

name: Child Support Assistance
description: Programs that assist individuals in obtaining, filing for or enforcing child support payments from a non-custodial parent.

name: Clothing-Clothing Banks
description: Programs that pay for or provide new or secondhand clothing for individuals that cannot afford to purchase clothing at retail prices.

name: Congregate Meals, Food Programs
description: Programs that provide hot meals on a regular basis to persons who may be in danger of nutritional deficits or who could profit from socializing with others.

name: Consumer Services
description: Programs that educate and/or protect individuals purchasing goods or services on their rights and how to exercise them.

name: Continuing Education
description: Programs that offer non-credit courses to adults looking to forward their education in some specific area.

name: Courts
description: Judicial bodies that exist to examine, interpret and apply the laws of the specific county, state, or country that the court system serves.

name: Crime Prevention
description: Programs that help individuals and groups of persons to prevent crime in their lives and neighborhoods.

name: Crime Victim Support
description: Programs that provide a variety of support services to persons who have been a victim of a crime.

name: Dental Care
description: Programs that specialize in the care of teeth and gums.

name: Diapers
description: Programs that pay for or provide either cloth or disposable diapers for those parents unable to afford them on their own.

name: Disaster Relief
description: Programs that offer short term assistance to individuals who have lived through a natural disaster and need medical attention, financial assistance or other support services.

name: Juvenile Diversion Programs
description: Programs that provide comprehensive social services to adolescents who have been convicted or are in danger of being convicted of a minor crime and are directed to participate in a diversion program as an alternative to arrest, prosecution or sentencing.

name: Donor Services
description: Programs that accept donations of goods and services and distribute them to individuals in need.

name: Early Childhood Education
description: Programs that provide recreational and educational activities to children aged birth to five years intended to foster social, emotional and mental growth.

name: Education
description: Programs that provide opportunities for individuals to acquire knowledge and skills that will help them later in life.

name: Educational Testing
description: Programs that use various tools to assess an individuals abilities, skills, knowledge, achievement or educational difficulties for the purpose of screening and individualized instruction or treatment.

name: Emergency Shelter
description: Programs that provide a temporary place to stay for newcomers, travelers, people who are in crisis, or homeless individuals in the community.

name: English as a Second Language
description: Programs that offer classes to teach non-English speaking persons to speak, read and write English more fluently.

name: Eye Care
description: Programs concerned with maintaining or improving the health of the eye.

name: Family Planning, Birth Control
description: Programs that provide assistance to persons or families who wish to control the size of their families, through birth control education and supplies.

name: Food Banks
description: Nonprofit organizations that collect, store and distribute food items to participating charitable agencies that use the food to serve the public.

name: Food Co-Ops
description: Programs in which the consumers and the agency share the cost of purchased food items that are then distributed to the consumers on a regular basis.

name: Food Pantries
description: Programs that collect donated food items and distribute them to individuals in emergency situations at no cost. May also provide vouchers to be used at a store to purchase needed food items.

name: Formula, Baby Food
description: Programs that provide infant formula and/or baby food.

name: Foster Care
description: Programs that provide alternative family living arrangements in agency-supervised private homes or facilities for a temporary period of time to those children who are physically or emotionally at-risk in their current living arrangements.

name: Furniture
description: Programs that donate or sell low-cost furniture items, including beds, to persons who are unable to purchase these items or pay regular store prices.

name: GED Instruction
description: Programs that provide the necessary educational instruction to help adults and/or eligible minors take a series of tests in order to obtain a high school equivalency certificate.

name: Government Surplus Food Sites
description: Established food distribution programs that periodically distribute surplus food items, collected by the government, to income eligible persons.

name: Health Care
description: Programs that provide primary medical treatment and prevention services to the public.

name: Health Care-Referrals
description: Programs that link persons seeking medical care to agencies or professionals providing qualified care in the desired specialization.

name: Health Education
description: Programs that provide the public with information and education on the prevention, early detection and treatment of potential health risks or illnesses.

name: Health Insurance
description: Programs that cover or reimburse persons for all or a portion of their medical expenses.

name: Health Screening, Diagnos Srvc.
description: Programs that utilize diagnostic tools and tests for the purpose of early detection of diseases or potential health risks.

name: Holiday Assistance
description: Programs that donate food or toys to needy persons or families during the holidays.

name: Home Delivered Meals
description: Programs that prepare and deliver regular meals to persons who are homebound and are unable to shop for groceries and cook for themselves.

name: Home Rehab, Repair Service
description: Programs that provide assistance in the form of labor or supplies to persons needing to make essential repairs to their homes to improve safety or liveability.

name: Hospice Care
description: Programs that provide services to the terminally ill and their families, usually including medical care, pain management, case management and counseling.

name: Hospitals
description: Medical institutions that provide a number of skilled medical services to persons with a wide variety of physical and mental conditions. Usually has facilities for persons who need to stay overnight.

name: Hostels
description: Dormitory-style accomidations for travelers, available at a low cost. Usually provides shower and kitchen facilities as well.

name: Household Goods
description: Programs that supply furnishings for the home.

name: Independent Living Skills Inst
description: Programs that assist people who have disabilities to learn the basic skills of daily living through counseling, instruction and practical experience.

name: Information, Referral
description: Programs which maintain information about human services in the community and link people who need assistance with appropriate service providers.

name: Interpretation, Translation
description: Programs that offer interpretation or translation services for non-English speaking persons, or persons with visual or hearing impairments.

name: Job Readiness
description: Programs that provide individual or group training for people who want to learn the behaviors and techniques that are required for acquiring and retaining a job.

name: Job Search, Placement
description: Programs that maintain listings of available employment opportunities and place people in appropriate job positions.

name: Job Training
description: Programs that prepare people for specific employment opportunities by providing instruction or experience in utilizing the skills required for specific job-related tasks.

name: Law Enforcement Agencies
description: Local, county, state and federal agencies that attempt to prevent crime and enforce the laws in that jurisdiction.

name: Lead Poisoning Screening
description: Programs that screen children for over exposure to elements containing lead.

name: Legal Services
description: Programs that provide legal guidance and/or representation.

name: Library Services
description: Libraries and other programs that provide information and reference services in the form of books, pamphlets, journals, audio and video tapes.

name: Licensing, Certification, Accred
description: Programs that authorize the practice of a profession or the operation of a business or community facility after determining that established standards have been met.

name: Medical Bill Assistance
description: Programs that may pay part of or all of medical bills that individuals have and cannot pay for themselves.

name: Medical Equipment, Supplies
description: Programs that either provide or pay for the purchase of certain medical equipment or supplies to individuals that are in need and could not purchase the equipment any other way.

name: Medication Information
description: Programs that offer information and answer questions on prescription, over the counter, or street drugs.

name: Mentoring Programs
description: Programs that provide companionship, guidance and/or role models for individuals who are disadvantaged because of age, income, physical or developmental disability or family environment.

name: Money Management Counseling
description: Programs that provide direct advice and guidance for people who need assistance in obtaining credit, obtaining or correcting information in their credit records or managing their financial resources.

name: Mortgage Assistance
description: Programs that make mortgage payments for people who cannot afford to make the payments themselves and who are at risk of losing their homes without assistance.

name: Nursing Facilities
description: Inpatient health care facilities that provide nursing and personal care over an extended period of time (usually more than thirty days) for people who require convalescent care.

name: Outreach Programs
description: Programs that increase the use of community resources by targeting certain segments of the population and making resources more available to them.

name: Parent, Child Activity Groups
description: Programs that provide regularly scheduled opportunities for parents to participate in a wide variety of recreational activities with their youngsters as a means of developing close family relationships.

name: Parenting Skills Development
description: Programs that teach skills that enable parents to deal constructively and consistently with a broad spectrum of child rearing problems.

name: Housing, Patient, Family
description: Programs that provide temporary housing for people who are ill or their family members while the ill persons receives medical care.

name: Physical Fitness
description: Programs that provide activities for people who want to improve their strength, flexibility, endurance, muscle tone, reflexes, cardiovascular health and/or other aspects of physical functioning.

name: Pregnancy Counseling
description: Programs that assist pregnant individuals to resolve any social or personal problems that have arisen from being pregnant or the prospect of parenthood, and help them to make appropriate decisions.

name: Prescription Expense Assistanc
description: Programs that purchase or contribute to the purchase of necessary prescription drugs for people who cannot afford to pay for the drugs themselves, who would be in an emergency situation without assistance and who qualify for this service on the basis of income or need.

name: Psychiatric Inpatient Tx
description: Programs offered in special units of general acute care hospitals that provide diagnostic and treatment services for children, adolescents and/or adults who have acute or chronic emotional disturbances.

name: Rat Control
description: Programs that investigate complaints from the public regarding rat infestations, inspect affected property and structures to determine the extent of the problem and provide eradication services or advice and necessary poisons for eradication.

name: Records, Licenses, Permits
description: Programs that issue written personal permits to engage in activities that are regulated by government authority.

name: Recreation
description: Programs that provide the opportunity for individuals to participate in some kind of recreational activity.

name: Rehabilitation
description: Programs that provide a combination of treatment and education services which are designed to restore maximum functioning and a satisfying level of independence for individuals with temporary or permanent disabilities.

name: Respite Care
description: Programs that offer temporary,  substitute living arrangements for dependent adults and children in order to provide a brief period of relief or rest (usually more than twenty-four hours) for the family members, guardians or other people who are their regular caretakers.

name: Retirement Homes, Communities
description: Residential facilities, apartments and/or planned communities exclusively for older adults that are designed to enable retired individuals or couples and other elderly people to have a form of independent living.

name: Roommate Matching Assistance
description: Programs that assist people who need a shared housing arrangement to identify others with whom they can share.

name: Scholarships
description: Programs that provide or assist students to apply for awards which usually involve money and/or reduced tuition.

name: Counseling-Sexual Assault
description: Programs that provide treatment services which may include emotional support, problem-solving assistance, information and guidance through a variety of counseling modalities for individuals who are coping with an emotional trauma as a result of sexual assault.

name: Small Business Development
description: Programs that provide technical assistance, venture capital, loans, loan guarantees or other forms of support for individuals or groups who want to establish or expand the operation of a small business enterprise or venture.

name: Soup Kitchens
description: Programs offered by churches, restaurants and other organizations that provide meals in a central location for indigent people who are hungry.

name: Education-Special
description: Programs that provide educational services including special placement and individualized programming, instruction and support services for exceptional children, youth and/or adults.

name: Housing, Subsidized Rental
description: Programs that make rental housing more readily available to low-income persons through federal and local housing programs.

name: Summer School Programs
description: Programs of instruction offered by learning institutions during the summer months.

name: Housing, Supervised Living
description: Programs that offer staff supervised housing in a group setting for disabled persons, seniors or other populations.

name: Telephone Reassurance
description: Programs that contact frail elderly individuals or people who have disabilities by telephone on a regular basis to ensure their good health and safety, and to reassure them that help is available if and when they need it.

name: Telephone Relay Services
description: Programs that link hearing impaired individuals with hearing individuals through the use of a TTY machine, a Teletype-writer, or teleprinter that transmits and receives printed messages in coded electronic signals.

name: Tenant, Landlord Assistance
description: Programs that provide assistance, information and support for tenants and/or landlords who are involved in rental housing disputes.

name: Training
description: Programs that offer training materials, packages or programs that are designed to increase the knowledge or skills of users or participants regarding particular a particular topic.

name: Transitional Housing
description: Programs that provide extended shelter (longer than 2 weeks) for homeless people who are willing to participate in developing a plan towards independent living.

name: Transportation
description: Programs that provide for the basic transport needs of the community including the local and long-distance conveyances.

name: Tutorial Services
description: Programs that provide individual or small group instruction for people who need assistance in learning the components of a prescribed curriculum.

name: Utility Assistance
description: Programs that provide financial assistance for people who are unable to pay their utility bills.

name: Volunteer Opportunities
description: Community agencies that have positions within their organizations for people who are willing to offer their services and work for free on a full or part-time basis.

name: Youth Development
description: Programs that provide a wide range of opportunities for recreational, cultural, civic and social activities that help youngsters develop their potential and grow into healthy, educated, responsible and productive adults.

name: Financial Assistance
description: Programs that provide on-going or limited monetary funds to individuals who lack the financial resources necessary to meet certain basic needs.

name: Fuel Assistance
description: Programs that assist persons with the cost of heating fuel bills or heating fuels.

name: Tax Credits
description: Programs that provide monetary tax refunds or tax credits to income eligible or otherwise qualified persons.

name: Health Care-Free or Low-Cost
description: Programs that provide free or low-cost primary medical treatment and prevention services to the public.

name: Voter Services, Elections
description: Programs that provide information regarding all aspects of the election process: filing for candidacy, registering to vote, ballot issues and voting records of rival candidates.

name: Vital Records
description: Programs that issue birth and death certificates.

name: Baby Supplies, Furniture
description: Programs that either pay for or provide secondhand baby furniture such as cribs, strollers, and bassinets to persons who are unable to obtain these items any other way.

name: Child Abuse
description: Using physical, sexual or emotional force on a regular basis against an individual under 18 years of age, creating a harmful environment for that individual.

name: Detox
description: Programs that help support individuals who are physically dependent on a substance during a period of time when they initially go without that substance.

name: Substance Abuse-Outpatient Tx
description: Community and hospital based programs that provide a variety of counseling and supportive services for individuals who have problems related to substance abuse who do not require 24-hour care.

name: Substance Abuse-Inpatient Tx
description: Health care facilities that provide long or short-term structured treatment programs and support services in the context of a 24-hour supervised environment for individuals who have substance abuse problems.

name: Methadone Treatment
description: Programs that utilize controlled dosages of methadone, an addictive synthetic opiate which prevents the symptoms associated with heroin withdrawal, in order to support the efforts of abusers to abstain from the use of heroin.

name: Substance Abuse-Education, Prev
description: Programs that provide a variety of services including individual, group and/or family counseling; knowledge and skill-enhancing activities; and structured groups which focus on family dynamics, problem-solving, self-esteem and other similar issues.

name: Substance Abuse-Halfway House
description: Programs that provide alcohol and other drug-free congregate living arrangements, relapse prevention programs and other services which facilitate the return to the community.

name: Substance Abuse
description: Programs that provide preventive diagnostic an inpatient, out-patient and residential treatment services as well as transitional support for people who have a physical and/or psychological dependency on a combination of addictive substances.

name: Substance Abuse-Friends, Family
description: Programs that serve the parents, children, spouses, partners or other relatives or significant others of people who abuse drugs whose own patterns of personal, social and familial coping have been significantly affected by ongoing interaction with and concern about the disabled individual.

name: Hotlines
description: Programs that receive telephone calls from persons in mental or physical crisis and work toward resolving the caller's problem and reduce or eliminate the caller's distress.

name: Housing, AIDS
description: Shelter, group homes or rental apartments specifically designated for people who have AIDS.

name: Heart Disease
description: Any number of pathological conditions of the heart.

name: AIDS Hotlines
description: Programs that offer a telephone service that enables people who are in trouble to talk confidentially about their personal problems with an empathetic lister.

name: Consumer Complaints
description: Programs that accept oral or written grievances from individuals regarding the actions of another person, professional or organization. May also help individuals to prepare a written statement accusing other persons or organizations of an offense or wrong-doing.

name: Counseling
description: Programs that provide prevention, diagnosis and treatment of mental health problems or help persons maintain a healthy mental attitude and cope with daily living. Services may be provided in a variety of settings.

name: MEAP Offices
description: Offices which accept applications for the Maryland Energy Assistance Program, which provides assistance towards the cost of winter heating bills for low-income persons in Maryland.

name: Physician Referral Services
description: Programs that link people who are in need of primary medical care with private medical practitioners who are qualified in the desired area of specialization.

name: Rental Allowance Programs
description: Programs that provide a rental allowance for qualified people who cannot afford to make the payments themselves.

name: Home Care- Medical
description: Programs that make necessary medical and personal care available to elderly, disabled, ill or convalescing individuals in their own homes.

name: Lifeline Systems
description: Programs that provide electronic equipment which links elderly or disabled persons to emergency  and/or medical assistance in times of crisis.

name: Head Start
description: Federally funded child development programs that provide educational, health and nutritional opportunities for low-income or at-risk children ages three to five and their parents.

name: Animal Services
description: Programs that work to promote the humane care of domestic and wild animals and to protect animals in their natural environments.

name: Domestic Violence Resources
description: Programs that provide support, counseling or guidance to individuals who are in or have been in an abusive relationship.

name: Suicide
description: Programs that offer services for suicidal persons or persons affected by suicide including information and referral, crisis intervention, hotlines and bereavement support groups.

name: Rent Assistance
description: Programs that make rental payments for people who cannot afford to make the payments themselves, who are at risk of eviction without assistance and who qualify for this service on the basis of income or need.

name: Inspections
description: Programs that investigate various facilities in order to ensure standards and quality.

name: Autism
description: A severe, lifelong developmental disability characterized by lack of meaningful speech, anti-social and/or affectionless behavior, fascination with objects, prolonged odd body movements, hypersensitivity and compulsive behavior.

name: Retinitis Pigmentosa
description: A chronic condition which starts in early childhood where certain optic features degenerate, eventually causing blindness.

name: Immunizations

name: Housing, Non-Subsidized Rental
description: Programs that provide low cost housing for persons with a low to moderate income.

name: Dropout Prevention
description: Programs that develop strategies to encourage children and adolescents to remain in school and complete their education.

name: Donor Services-Vehicles
description: Programs that accept donations of motor vehicles to either be used by an agency or individual in need or sold to gain financial resources.

name: Drug Abusers
description: Persons who have a physical or psychological dependence on a variety of substances that are used to alter the user's mood or perceptions, alleviate pain, relieve tension, etc.

name: Advocacy-Animal Rights
description: Programs that support the passage and enforcement of laws and other social measures that protect domestic and wild animals from cruelty or neglect or from the use of experimental purposes.

name: Representative Payee
description: Programs that manage the finances of individuals who are unable to do so for themselves.

name: Public Health
description: Programs that protect and improve the health of the community through comprehensive efforts to prevent, control and eradicate communicable diseases; eliminate environmental health hazards and control occupational health hazards.

name: Tax Assistance
description: Programs that provide advice and guidance to people who need tax information, tax forms, or require assistance in preparing and filling tax returns.

name: Pediatrics
description: Programs staffed by medical specialists who provide services for the physical health of infants, children and adolescents.

name: Nutrition Education
description: Programs that provide information about the basic principles of a healthy diet, diets for specific health conditions, food handling, food preparation and shopping skills.

name: Childbirth Classes
description: Programs that provide educational and medical information to pregnant women and their partners in order to prepare them for the birthing process.

name: Safety Awareness, Education
description: Programs that increase the public's awareness of the measures people can take to reduce the risks of injuries or accidents at home, work, school or while driving.  May also include education on how to avoid being a victim of crime.

name: Donor Services-Organ, Tissue
description: Programs that accept donated hearts, kidneys, livers, skin and other organs for use in transplant operations.

name: CPR Instruction
description: Programs that provide instruction in the appropriate techniques of artificial circulation and artificial respiration to prolong life in a medical emergency.

name: First Aid Instruction
description: Programs that provide basic lifesaving techniques to be administered to individuals who have been injured.

name: After School Programs
description: Programs that provide supervised care as well as recreational and educational programs for school aged children following the end of the school day.

name: Violence Prevention
description: Programs that conduct either educational campaigns, provide diversion activities or provide counseling with the objective of persuading individuals to avoid violent behaviors.

name: Financial Assistance-AIDS, HIV
description: Programs that provide on-going or limited monetary funds to persons with AIDS or HIV who lack the financial resources necessary to meet certain needs.

name: Volunteer Opportunities-Youth
description: Programs that seek to locate, encourage and use young volunteers to help in community based projects.

name: Teen Pregnancy Prevention
description: Programs providing educational/supportive services which promote healthy attitudes and behaviors among teens regarding sexuality, heighten awareness of the consequences of sexual activity and help teens avoid unwanted pregnancies.

name: Pet Visitation
description: Programs that help emotionally disturbed, isolated, elderly, ailing, or disabled people to improve their personal and social functioning by giving them an opportunity to interact and relate to a domestic animal that is kept as a pet.

name: Aplastic Anemia
description: A severe anemia due to the destruction or depressed function of the bone marrow, with no regenerative hyperplasia.

name: Mortgage Foreclosure Couns.
description: Programs that provide direct advice and guidance and/or legal representation for people who are unable to make their mortgage payments and who are at risk of losing their homes through foreclosure.

name: Seasonal Shelter
description: Programs that provide a temporary place to stay for homeless people who have no other housing resources during the winter.

name: TDAP
description: Temporay Disability Assistance Program (formerly TEMHA) is a program for single, disabled adults that provides limited cash grants and may offer limited flex funds for housing, utilities, security deposits, pharmaceutical/medical supplies (for those not on PCMI), medical transportation and Tel-Life phone services.

name: Medication Monitoring
description: Programs for elderly, ailing or mentally ill people to evaluate the need for medication, to prescribe an appropriate drug, and to offer periodic follow-up to monitor the effectiveness of the medication.

name: Computer Training
description: Programs that provide instruction for individuals who want to learn or perfect their skills in operating computers and computer programs.

name: Pharmacy Services
description: Organizations that are involved in storing, preparing, and dispensing drugs in accordance with prescriptions prepared by licensed physicians.

name: Home Rehab, Repair Loans
description: Programs that provide loans for income-eligible people who want to arrange for repairs or modifications in their homes to improve safety or liveability. Also included are programs that assist in the acquisition of home improvement loans.

name: Home Purchase Loan-Low Income
description: Programs that provide direct or guaranteed housing loans for low-income families who do not have sufficient resources to purchase a home for themselves and could not otherwise secure credit for this purpose. Also included are programs that provide loans to be used towards the down payment on a home or closing costs.

name: Sex Offenders
description: Programs that help individuals who have committed rape or other sexual assault, nonfamilial child sexual abuse, indecent exposure, voyeurism or other sexual offenses.

name: Right to Life Counseling
description: Programs that encourage pregnant women whose plans for their pregnancies are uncertain to consider alternatives to abortion including adoption or single parenthood.

name: Psychiatric Outpatient Tx
description: Programs that provide a therapeutic environment for individuals who have acute or chronic mental or emotional disturbances, who do not require full-time hospital care, but who can benefit from a structured environment for some portion of the day or week. Services may include individual, group and/ or family therapy; social and recreational activities; and a range of adjunctive therapies.

name: Child Care Resource & Referral
description: Programs that maintain lists of child care resources and link families who are in need of child care services with appropriate providers.

name: Child Care Subsidies
description: Programs that either provide vouchers for or underwrite a portion of the cost of child care in public or private child care facilities for low-income families where the parents are working, in school, or in a training program.

name: Sen.Asst.Liv.Fac.-Low, Mod Inco
description: Programs that provide housing in a group setting for low to moderate income seniors who need some assistance with mobility, medications and daily living tasks.

name: Home Rental Listings-Low Cost
description: Programs that maintain lists of available low-cost apartments and houses for lease or rent that low-income people in search of housing can review.

name: Sexually Abused Children
description: Individuals younger than 18 who have been sexually assaulted by a family member, acquaintance, or stranger or who have been subjected to sexual exploitation in the form of child prostitution or child pornography.

name: Counseling-Child Sex. Assault
description: Programs that provide crisis, short-term and/or on-going in-person counseling for children who are coping with the emotional trauma that is the result of sexual assault.

name: Neighborhood Revitalization
description: Programs that advocate or provide for the renewal, rehabilitation, or clean-up of homes, streets, sidewalks, and incidental recreational areas in residential communities that are blighted or depressed.

name: Police, Community Relations Grp
description: Organization whose members have joined together on a voluntary basis to work for increased understanding between the community and law enforcement agencies.

name: Pregnant Teens
description: Adolescents ages 13-17 who are expecting a child.

name: Career Counseling-Women
description: Programs for women that provide career advice and guidance, and evaluate an individual's abilities and interests in order to help them choose a vocation.

name: Hotlines-Youth
description: Programs that receive telephone calls from children or adolescents in mental or physical crisis and work toward resolving the caller's problem and reduce or eliminate the caller's distress.

name: Homeless-Children
description: Programs that provide services to children or adolescents without a permanent residence or place to stay.

name: Volunteer Opportunity-Holiday
description: Community agencies that have positions within their organizations during the holiday season for people who are willing to offer their services and work for free on a full or part-time basis.

name: Life Skills
description: Programs that offer training that focuses on the knowledge and skills an individual may need to make a successful transition to independent living. Participants may include teens living on their own, new widows, battered women, displaced homemakers and others who have lived in an environment in which decision making and responsibilities of daily living have been handled by another.

name: Information, Referral-Out of St
description: Programs outside of Maryland that maintain information about human services in the community and link people who need assistance with appropriate service providers.

name: Medicare
description: A federally funded program administered by the Social Security Administration that provides hospital and medical insurance for people age 65 and older; for disabled individuals younger than 65  years; and insured workers and their dependents who need dialysis or a kidney transplant.

name: Food Vouchers
description: Programs that provide persons in emergency situations with food coupons which can be exchanged for food products that have been determined nutritious.

name: Out-of-State Resources
description: Resources that are not physically located within Maryland or Washington, D.C.

name: Animal Cruelty
description: Programs that investigate reports of cruelty to animals, intervene in the situation and, when warrented, remove pets who have been abused or neglected and initiate legal proceedings against abusive owners.

name: Spay, Neuter Programs
description: Programs that surgically alter animals to prevent them from reproducing.

name: Animal Adoption
description: Programs that place stray and homeless animals with people willing to provide care for domestic pets such as dogs and cats, etc.

name: Rabies Vaccination
description: Programs that surgically inoculate animals to prevent them from contracting rabies, an acute viral disease that attacks the nervous system of animals and can be fatal if untreated.

name: Americorps
description: Programs linked to local or national Americorps programs that provide educational benefits, health insurance and a stipend in exchange for community service hours in the areas of education, public safety, human welfare and the environment.

name: Lung Disease
description: Any disease that affects the normal function of the lungs such as, but not limited to, asthma, emphysema, sarcoidosis, etc.

name: Holiday Assistance-Thanksgivin
description: Programs that provide assistance for low-income and indigent community residents to facilitate their ability to celebrate and enjoy Thanksgiving.

name: Holiday Assistance-Christmas
description: Programs that sponsor seasonal activities and/or provide special assistance for low-income and indigent community residents to facilitate their ability to celebrate and enjoy Christmas/Chanuka/Kwanzaa.

name: Clothing-Work
description: Programs that pay for or provide new or secondhand uniforms or other working clothes for individuals who cannot afford to purchase clothing at retail prices.

name: Therapeutic Recreation
description: Programs that use expressive, recreational or other specialized interventions as auxiliary forms of treatment to improve the adjustment of individuals who have emotional, developmental, social or physical problems.

name: Chore Services
description: Programs that go into households whose routines have been disrupted by illness, disability or other problems and resume household activities including meal preparation, child care, shopping, budgeting and light housekeeping.

name: Home Care- Family Services
description: In-home programs for that are designed to foster healthy family development by providing services including home management instruction, parenting skills development, case management services, stress management, pregnancy education and AIDS awareness.

name: Home Care- Mental Health
description: Programs that offer in-home intervention, treatment, case management, medication monitoring and other services for persons suffering from emotional or mental illness.

name: Agricultural Assistance
description: Programs that provide information and technical assistance or support regarding planting, nuturing, protection and utilization of agricultural products, including cultivation of gardens and household plants.

name: Anger Management
description: Programs that provide education or counseling for people who need to learn to deal with their anger in a positive, functional way.

name: Cooling Centers
description: Programs that offer sites for seniors or other fragile persons seeking temporary relief from the heat during the summer months.  These programs may also offer activities or meals as well.

name: Acupuncture
description: Programs that eliminate/reduce pain or treat other health problems by passing long needles through the skin to specifc points in the body.

name: Sex Education
description: Programs that provide information and instruction concerning the physiological and emotional aspects of human sexuality, including anatomy, reproduction, birth control, etc.

name: Companions, Friendly Visitors
description: Programs that provide shared, in-home, activities and/or role models for individuals seeking social stimulation or who lack companionship and guidance. This may also include some animal services.

name: Peace Corps
description: A federal volunteer program that provides opportunities for people to volunteer their time and work for low wages in order to help developing countries make improvements in areas of agricultural and rual development.

name: Smoke Detectors
description: Programs that pay for or supply smoke detection devices that can be installed in homes, apartments or commercial buildings.

name: Personal Items
description: Programs that pay for, provide  or accept donations of new or second-hand personal necessities, such as shampoo, toothpaste, combs, etc. to distribute to  those individuals who cannot afford these items at regular retail costs.

name: Child Find Programs
description: Programs that develop and implement plans for locating and identifying children who have targeted disabling conditions and therefore qualify for various types of assistance.

name: UWCM Funded Agencies
description: Programs that receive funding from the United Way of Central Maryland.  (See also United Way Services Directory & Contributor's Guide)

name: Programs of UWCM Agencies
description: Programs operated by Affiliated Agencies of the United Way of Central Maryland.  (See keyword "Affiliated Agencies" and also the United Way of Central Maryland's Agency Services Directory and Contributor's Guide.)

name: Donor Services-Holiday
description: Programs that seek donations of items particular to the holidays (Thanksgiving, Hanukkah, Christmas, etc.).

name: Prostate Cancer
description: A condition in which there are malignant tumors in the prostate gland.

name: AIDS-Pediatric
description: Programs that provide health services for infants or children who have contracted AIDS/HIV.

name: Podiatry, Foot Care
description: Programs that provide comprehensive services for individuals who have diseases or injuries to the feet.

name: Dermatology, Skin Care
description: Programs that provide diagnostic and/or treatment services for disorders of the skin and/or offer advice regarding the care of normal skin.

name: High Blood Pressure
description: A condition in which the patient has a higher blood pressure than normal.  In general, if on several separate occasions the systolic pressure is above 140 or the diastolic is above 90, the person is considered to have elevated blood pressure.

name: Psych, Psychological Eval
description: Programs that evaluate the mental or emotional status or functioning of people who may be experiencing acute or chronic disturbances.

name: Postpartum Care
description: Programs that provide follow-up medical care for women during the first six weeks following delivery to ensure that they are recovering normally from childbirth.

name: Mammograms, Breast Exams
description: Programs that offer screening procedures for early detection of breast cancer.

name: OHEP Programs
description: Office of Home Energy Programs.  Offices that provide one or more type of energy assistance (MEAP grants, fuel assistance, etc.).  Formerly known as the Maryland Energy Assistance Program.

name: Family Based Services
description: Programs that provide a variety of social services designed to support healthy family development and prevent unnecessary placement of children into foster care.

name: Homeowner Services
description: Programs that provide support services (counseling, home modification/repair, financial  assistance, tax credits, etc.) for homeowners.

name: Counseling-Individual
description: Programs that offer therapeutic sessions in which the therapist works on a one-to-one basis with clients to resolve mental, emotional or social problems.

name: School Supplies
description: Programs that offer free or low-cost school supplies such as pencils/pens, notebooks, etc. (This may also include school uniforms.)

name: Widows, Widowers Services
description: Programs that provide services (counseling , support groups, I & R, etc.) for men and women who have lost partners due to death.

name: Counseling-Group
description: Programs that offer therapist-facilitated treatment sessions in which groups of individuals, couples or families discuss their attitudes, feelings and problems and, with input from other group members, attempt to achieve greater self and interpersonal understanding and adjustment and explore solutions to their problems.

name: Homeless Families
description: Families who may be living on the streets, in cars or in other make-shift arrangements.

name: Harvest of Plenty (HOP)
description: A specially funded holiday food distribution program that provides food and/or food vouchers to low-income families in Baltimore City for the Thanksgiving holiday.

name: Holiday Assistance-Easter
description: Programs that offer special assistance or services to make the Easter season more enjoyable.

name: Recreation-Asians
description: Programs that provide social and recreational activities for the Asian community.

name: Eviction-Emergency Storage
description: Programs that provide temporary storage of household items after an eviction has occurred.

name: I & R Providers
description: Programs whose main purpose is to maintain information about health and human service resources in the community and to link people in need with appropriate community resources.

name: Schizophrenia
description: A mental disorder characterized by separation between thought and emotion, delusions and bizarre behavior, etc. Onset is typically before age 45.

name: Trigeminal Neuralgia (TN)
description: A condition caused by pressure on the trigeminal nerve that sends severe pain to the forehead and jaw.

name: Prostitutes
description: Men and women who perform sexual acts for money or its equivalent.

name: Home Schooling
description: A formal program of primary and secondary education provided by parents who are licensed to teach their children in the home.

name: Health Care-Mobile
description: Programs that go out into the community to provide free or low-cost basic health services, including mental health, which operate via a mobile health station such as a van, bus, etc.

name: Genetic Diseases
description: Any of a number of illnesses or conditions that are hereditary or transmitted from parent to offspring.

name: Gay, Lesbian Parents, Families
description: Family units that consist of one or more members (parent or child) who identifies as gay/lesbian.

name: Lead Removal
description: The service where lead is removed from homes, institutions or public buildings in order to comply with health code standards.

name: Menopause
description: That period which marks the permanent cessation of menstrual activity which usually occurs in women age thirty-five to fifty-eight.  Its onset may be accompanied by hot and cold flashes, feelings of weakness and in some case, mental depression.

name: Homeless-Veterans
description: Programs that provide services to veterans without a permanent residence or place to stay.

name: Foster Grandparent Programs
description: Programs that provide volunteer opportunities for people, ages 60 and older, to render support services for children with special needs.

name: School System Advocacy
description: Programs that assist families in their interactions with the school system which may include help with school registration, enrollment of children in special programs, intervention on behalf of students facing disciplinary action or expulsion and other activities which facilitate communication between families and school staff.

name: Hepatitis
description: An inflammation of the liver of viral or toxic origin.

name: Colon Cancer
description: A condition where there is a malignancy in the tissue of the larger intestines that begins with the cecum and continues to the anus.

name: Rectal Cancer
description: A condition in which there is a malignancy in the lower part of the large intestine between the sigmoid flecture and the anal canal.

name: Environmental Improvement
description: Programs responsible for the conservation of endangered land, water, energy and wildlife resources and for the protection, beautification and improved accessibility of the urban environment.

name: Urology
description: The management of benign and malignant medical and surgical disorders of the adrenal gland and genitourinary system.

name: Clothing-School Uniforms
description: Programs that provide school uniforms free, low cost or provide vouchers for children whose parents cannot afford to purchase these items at retail prices.

name: Baby Sitter Instruction
description: Programs that offer training that is designed to increase the knowledge and skills of persons who are interested in the care of children.

name: Aspergers Syndrome
description: Also known as Asperger's Disorder or Autistic Psychopathy. A Pervasive Developmental Disorder (PDD) characterized by severe and sustained impairment in social interaction, restricted and repetitive patterns of behavior, interests and activities and is often more common in males.

name: Disaster Relief-International
description: Organizations that provide assistance to people overseas and in the United States who suffer from hunger, poverty and disease or from the ravages of war, oppression and natural disasters.

name: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
description: A disorder to which individuals who have experienced a psychologically traumatizing event experience such symptoms as, but not limited to: reexperiencing the event through intrusive recollections or dreams; survivor's guilt; avoidance of memories that recall the trauma, sleep disturbance, etc.

name: Disaster Preparedness
description: Programs that increase public awareness of measures people can take before, during, and after a major disaster to reduce the loss of life and property & improve chances for survival.

name: Poison Information, Control
description: Programs that provide emergency information for medical personnel or others who may need to take immediate correctve action to treat an individual who has been poisoned or to prevent such an occurence.

name: Rumor Control
description: Organizations or offices that are responsible for intercepting rumors and officially confirming their truth or falsity.

name: Public Awareness, Education
description: Programs that provide information and/or a variety of materials to make the public aware of human service needs of the community, resources available to meet those needs and issues relevant to specific social problems.

name: Latchkey Kids
description: Youth who have to stay unsupervised in their homes after school or throughout the day because their parent(s) work and childcare is unavailable.

name: Donor Services-Land, Property
description: Programs that accept donations of personal residences, vacation homes, commercial buildings, vacant lots or other pieces of real estate and sell the property to raise money for charitable purposes.

name: Donor Services-Blood
description: Programs that acquire, process and store whole blood and blood products including red blood cells, white blood cells, platelets and plasma for use by people who need transfustions.

name: Donor Services-Clothing
description: Programs that accept new or secondhand clothing from individuals and organizations, refurbish them if necessary, and  keep them for use in their own program or donate them to other organizations for distribution to the people they serve.

name: Donor Services-Household Goods
description: Programs that accept new or secondhand  furniture, appliances, kitchenware, linens, cleaning supplies and other consumer products from individuals or organizations and keep them for use in their own programs or donate them to other organizations for distribution for the people they serve.

name: Water Bill Assistance
description: Programs that pay all or a portion of the water bills of people who cannot afford to make the payments themselves, whose water has been or as at risk of being shut off and who qualify on the basis of income/need.

name: Geriatric Assessment
description: Programs that evaluate the physical condition and psychological functioning of elderly persons to isolate causes of problems and to identify possible solutions.

name: Donor Services-Cell phones
description: Programs that accept donations of new or used cellular phones to then distribute the phones to persons in need (low-income, seniors, etc.) for special services.

name: Donor Services-Computer, Office
description: Programs that accept new/used office supplies (furniture, desks, computers, etc.) and in turn supply them to agencies or individuals in need for free or for a low fee.

name: Firearm Safety
description: Programs designed to increase techniques for safely handling, storing, cleaning, etc. rifles, shot guns, pistols and other firearms.

name: Case Management-Offenders, Ex-O
description: Programs that provide the coordination of social services to prisoners/offenders or ex-offenders

name: Outreach Programs-Offenders, Ex
description: Programs that increase use of community resources by targeting offenders/ex-offenders and making these resources more available to them.

name: Outreach Programs-Immigrants
description: Programs that increase the use of community resources by targeting immigrants and/or refugees and making these resources more available to them.

name: Education-Gifted, Talented
description: Programs for children and youth who are gifted and talented (e.g. endowed with a high degree of mental ability or demonstrate unusual physical coordination, creativity or talent) usually in regular school setting.

name: TMJ (TemporomandibularJoint..)
description: Severe aching pain affecting the head, jaw and face that is believed to result when the temporomandibular joints, the muscles and ligaments that control them do not work together correctly.

name: Public Safety
description: Ensures the safety of the community by sponsoring activities which make the public aware of measures they can take to eliminate safety hazards, prevent accidents and be prepared for survival in case of a major disaster.

name: Lyme Disease
description: A debilitating disease of the nervous system and joints which sometimes leads to heart problems, meningitis and chronic arthritis.  It is caused by a bacterium transmitted to humans by the bite of a tick.

name: Information, Referral-zipcodes
description: Programs that provide information on mailing zipcodes.

name: Donor Services-Books
description: Programs that accept new or used books, magazines and other reading materials from individuals and organizations and keep them for use in their own program or donate them to libraries, schools and other community agencies.

name: Information, Referral-AIDS, HIV
description: Programs which maintain information about services in the community and link persons who may be affected by HIV/AIDS with appropriate service providers.

name: Dance Therapy
description: Programs that enable individuals who have mental, emotional or social problems to achieve self-expression and emotional release through folk dancing, ballroom dancing, exercising to music and other rhythmic motor activities.

name: Wish Granting, Foundations
description: Programs that provide support for adults or children who are terminally ill by granting one wish (eg: a trip to Disneyland, a family reunion, etc.).

name: Donor Services-Medical
description: Programs that accept medical equipment, supplies or medicines and distribute them for free or low-cost or via medical loan closets.

name: Automobiles
description: Programs that provide new and/or second-hand automobiles to individuals who qualify on the basis of income, age or disability.

name: Donor Services-Food
description: Programs that accept food and other food sources from individuals or organizations and keep the food for use in their own program or doante it to food banks, pantries, meal programs, etc.

name: Sexual Addiction
description: Behavior that is characterized by a compulsive need to engage in a repetitive series of sexual encounters which interfere with the person's ability to develop positive intimate relationships and to learn to cope with life stresses in a healthy manner.

name: Applications, Forms
description: Programs that help people obtain, complete, and/or file official forms, certificates, documents, applications, or other legal paperwork.

name: Youth Agricultural Programs
description: Voluntary, informal education programs that emphasize the total development of young people who are members through work on the animal, engineering, family/consumer, health, resource, plant or social science project of their choice in consultation with their parents and supervising adult volunteers. Members also participate in camping activities, leadership conferences, awards programs and community service activities.

name: At Risk Youth
description: Youth who, because of their economic, environmental or family situation, a health problem or disability or past behavior, are considered more likely than others to be affected by or become involved in child abuse or neglect, substance abuse, juvenile delinquency, gang behavior, adolescent pregnancy, truancy, unemployment and other problems which threaten their health, safety and/or personal development.

name: Job Corps
description: A nationwide, government-subsidized youth training program that provides remedial education, vocational training and useful work experience including on-the-job training for low and moderate-income, disadvantaged youth who have poor job skills.

name: Computers
description: Programs that provide access to personal computers, computer software and necessary peripherals.

name: York County, PA Resources
description: Programs that serve persons who live or work in York County, PA

name: Buprenorphine treatment
description: Drug therapy intended to ease withdrawal sysmptoms in people addicted to opiates such as heroin, oxycodone, methadone, hydrocodone, morphine, and opium.  Medication is either administered at a clinic or at home via prescription.  Buprenorphine goes by the brand names Subutex and Suboxone.

name: Medicare Information, Counselin
description: Programs that offer information and guidance for older adults and people with disabilities regarding their health insurance options with the objective of empowering them to make informed choices. These programs also provide counseling and assistance about the subsidies that are available to low income beneficiaries enrolled in the Part D Prescription Drug Benefit; and may also provide information about Medicaid and the linkages between the two programs, referrals to appropriate state and local agencies involved in the Medicaid program, information about other Medicare-related entities (such as peer review organizations, Medicare-approved prescription drug plans, fiscal intermediaries and carriers), and assistance in completing Medicare insurance forms.

name: Benefits Screening
description: Programs that provide benefits screening services which help individuals determine whether they are eligible for benefits through any of a wide variety of public and private federal, state and local programs. In addition to identifying the programs that a person may be eligible to receive, the service generally also provides a detailed description of the programs, local contacts for additional information (typically the addresses and phone numbers of where to apply for the programs), and materials to help successfully apply for each program. Included are programs that provide this service online and those that do benefits screening via the telephone or in-person. Some benefits screening programs may focus on specific populations such as older adults and people with disabilities; or specific aspects of benefits eligibility such as the impact that working will have on their benefits as an aid to helping people make informed decisions regarding whether to work. Also included are programs that help people complete the benefits screening form.

name: HOPE Housing Counselors
description: Home Owners Preserving Equity (HOPE) is a foreclosure prevention and financial assistance program of the MD Department of Housing & Community Development in partnership with local government and community-based nonprofit organizations.

name: Lifeline Refinance Mortgage
description: Provides a refinancing option to those who may be facing difficulties after financing their homes with adjustable rate or other unfavorable mortgages, or with mortgages that no longer fit their financial situation.

name: Bridge to Hope Loan
description: Provides homeowners with short-term relief to maintain homeownership by preventing residential mortgage foreclosures resulting from borrowers experiencing financial difficulty caused by either a sub-prime or exotic mortgage, such as a negative amortization loan or an adjustable rate mortgage (ARM) loan that has, or is preparing to, reset.

name: Homesaver Refinance Mortgage
description: Provides a refinancing option to those with sub-prime or exotic mortgages and are experiencing difficulties as a result of mortgage default, low credit scores and/or a mortgage greater than the current value of their home.

name: Abortion Services
description: Programs that provide access to pregnancy termination services for individuals who want to avoid an unplanned or unwanted birth.
